quizzes.question: In which year did the modern Olympic Games start?
quizzes.fact: The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece.

quizzes.question: Who is known as the father of the modern Olympic Games?
quizzes.fact: Coubertin revived the Olympic Games in 1896.

quizzes.question: Which city hosted the 2000 Summer Olympics?
quizzes.fact: The Sydney 2000 Olympics are remembered for their excellent organization and sportsmanship.

quizzes.question: What is the Olympic motto?
quizzes.fact: The Olympic motto 'Citius, Altius, Fortius' was proposed by Pierre de Coubertin.

quizzes.question: Which country has won the most Olympic gold medals?
quizzes.fact: The USA has consistently dominated the Olympic medal tally.

quizzes.question: Which sport was introduced in the Olympics for the first time in 1900?
quizzes.fact: Tennis returned to the Olympics after a long absence in 1988.

quizzes.question: How often are the Summer Olympics held?
quizzes.fact: The Summer Olympics are held every four years, except during war times.

quizzes.question: What is the name of the Olympic flame's journey from Greece to the host city?
quizzes.fact: The torch relay symbolizes the connection between the ancient and modern Games.

quizzes.question: Which city will host the 2024 Summer Olympics?
quizzes.fact: Paris will host the Olympics for the third time, previously hosting in 1900 and 1924.

quizzes.question: What is the significance of the Olympic rings?
quizzes.fact: The five interlocking rings represent the five inhabited continents.

quizzes.question: Which country first included women in their Olympic team?
quizzes.fact: Women were first allowed to compete in the 1900 Olympics in Paris.

quizzes.question: What is the official Olympic song?
quizzes.fact: The Olympic Fanfare was composed by John Williams for the 1984 Los Angeles Games.

quizzes.question: What do the colors of the Olympic flag represent?
quizzes.fact: The colors of the Olympic rings are found in all national flags.

quizzes.question: Which Olympic Games were the first to be televised?
quizzes.fact: The Berlin Olympics were the first Games to be televised live.

quizzes.question: What year were the Winter Olympics first held?
quizzes.fact: The first Winter Olympics were held in Chamonix, France.

quizzes.question: Which country will host the 2026 Winter Olympics?
quizzes.fact: Italy will host the Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo.

quizzes.question: Which athlete has won the most Olympic medals?
quizzes.fact: Michael Phelps won a total of 28 Olympic medals, 23 of which are gold.

quizzes.question: In which sport do athletes compete for the Ironman title?
quizzes.fact: The Ironman consists of a 2.4-mile swim, a 112-mile bike ride, and a 26.2-mile run.

quizzes.question: What year did the Olympics first include the team sports?
quizzes.fact: Team sports were first included in the 1900 Paris Olympics.

quizzes.question: What is the Olympic motto in Latin?
quizzes.fact: It means 'Faster, Higher, Stronger'.
